title: Letizia Bonaparte
summary: Maria-Letizia Buonaparte (née Ramolino; 24 August 1750 (or 1749) – 2 February 1836),  known as Letizia Bonaparte, was a Corsican noblewoman and mother of Napoleon I of France. She became known as “Madame Mère” after the proclamation of the Empire. She spent her later years in Rome where she died in February 1836.
